result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Michael McLafferty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations. Enroll within 60 days.

Absolute sobriety.

No drugs without a prescription and only in amount prescribed. 

No drug paraphernalia. 

No alcohol.

No contact with co-defendant A.H.

Must complete an Anger Management Assessment if required by agent and comply with recommendations.

Must complete any programming or treatment required by agent.  

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

records.addlTxt:
10:26 AM Defendant Justin Michael McLafferty in court.  Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson in court for Justin Michael McLafferty.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Atty Anderson recites agreement. On count 2- def- NC plea. On count 3- def- G plea. CT accepts pleas, adj G. Counts 1, 4 and 5 are RI&D on state's motion.

SENTENCE: W/held sent 1 year probation. AODA and comply. AS. No drugs without a prescription. No drug para. No alcohol. No contact with co-def AH.  $265.60 fine/costs on each count, $200 DNA surcharge on each count, DNA sample. Any programming or treatment required by agent. Anger management assessment if required by agent. Must report to probation today. PCR. CT clarifies probation is w/held 1 year on each count. 10:43 am adj. Bond will be applied.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
